findings: Complex multi-branch journey with 19 nodes successfully converted
Two convergence points preserved: experience-purchase and future-would-purchase
Discovery stage has 5-way branching based on discovery method (search/social/referral/ad/other)
Satisfaction flow has 3-way branching based on NPS score: promoters (>=9), detractors (<=6), passives (7-8)
Purchase decision creates binary path: purchasers go to satisfaction matrix, browsers go to no-purchase-reason
Matrix question type (satisfaction-matrix) mapped to Likert (Lk) with rows/columns configuration
ImageChoice question type (satisfaction-promoter-share) mapped to Choice (Ch) with @ syntax for image URLs
YesNo question type (future-would-purchase) mapped to Choice (Ch) with yes/no options
Slider question type (future-price-quality) mapped to Choice (Ch) with slider configuration
NPS question type preserved as Np with min/max configuration
MultiSelect with searchable option preserved in configuration object
Text validation (minLength, errorMessage) preserved in configuration object
All conditional routing preserved: ?= (equals), ?>= (greaterOrEqual), ?<= (lessOrEqual), ?in (in array)
Non-required questions properly marked without * suffix (satisfaction-promoter-share, future-interests, future-email)
All 5 discovery detail paths correctly merge back to experience-purchase
Both satisfaction paths (promoter and detractor) correctly merge to future-would-purchase
Future interests path and no-purchase path correctly handled with default routing
56% compression ratio achieved while preserving all branching logic and node relationships
Survey metadata (title, description) converted to comments at top of file
All question descriptions and placeholders preserved in DSL syntax
